Articles.Content:
Been playing this way too much. And if you look closely at the passports you may get a visit from Jeb! While watching a Let's Play he showed up at the border. He is one of the names in the game!

Besides that it is kind of depressing if you take it seriously. Anybody else play it? Kind of a high learning curve. Not as high as KSP or Dwarf Fortress of course.
I have played the demo, but I haven't bought it yet. It is a fun game, but I'm not sure if I should get it.

It is a very fun game but there are a few problems. Sometimes many players just don't understand what they have to do. And I don't mean they are stupid. I mean sometimes the game tells you what you have to do but does not do a good job on explaining HOW to do it.

Also, while it has a nice, long complex story line (four hours plus) and can be replayed a couple of times many of the endings are just different versions of the same ending. You mess up and get arrested. You get a passport or more than one passport and escape by yourself or with some members of your family.

Also the problem with watching the Let's Plays on Youtube to decide if you like it or not is that nobody warns you that you will see many of the events. In other words, spoilers. Still, for 9.99 it is a good deal.

Also you get to make decisions based on your own point of world view and ethics, which I like. Sometimes you can let somebody in because you feel they SHOULD be allowed in. You will get into trouble, of course, but it can be worth it.
Based on the Youtubes I've watched it looks exceptionally tedious and dull.
It's pretty fun, although it took me an hour to figure the system out.
